_header: Say me wight in the broom
_description: Tell me, Wight in the Broom — one 6-line stanza, couplets

CamTCC323.Transcription:
Say me viit in þe bromteche me wou i sule donþat min
                    hosebondeme louien woldeHold þine tunke stille& hawe al
                    þine wille

Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             English Lyrics of the XIIIth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1932: 32.
James,  Montague Rhodes. 
             Catalogue of the
                    Western Manuscripts in the Library of Trinity College, Cambridge.
         4 vols. Cambridge: at the UP, 1900-1904: 1.441.
Dickins,  Bruce,  and  Richard M. Wilson.  
             Early Middle English Texts.
         Cambridge: at the University Press, 1951: 119.
Silverstein,  Theodore,
                        ed.  
             Medieval English Lyrics.
         York Medieval Texts. London: Edw. Arnold, 1971: 40.
Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 63.

BLAdd11579.Transcription:
Sey wist y þe bromHwat ys me for to donIch haue þe
                    werreste bondeþat ys in oni londe
BLAdd11579.Note:
In the second line, it appears that the scribe originally copied
                    ‘Wwat’, which he corrected to ‘Hwat’.
BLAdd11579.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             English Lyrics of the XIIIth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1932: 32.

             A selection of Latin stories.
Percy Society
         8. London: Richard, 1842: 24.

             Catalogue of Romances in the Department of MSS. in the British
                Museum.
         Vol. 3. London, 1910: 3.529 (couplet only).
Coulton,  George Gordon. 
             Life in the Middle Ages.

Oliver,  Raymond. 
             Poems Without Names: The English Lyric 1200-1500.
         Berkeley, CA: University of California, 1970: 37.

Lam78.Transcription:
Wyȝt in the bromHwat schal I donI haue an
                    housebondeThe worst in thys londeȝyf thyn housebonde ys
                    ylleHwan he chyt hold de stylle
Lam78.Attributed Title:
De muliere que per pacienciam virum suum sibi fecit mansuetum (f.
                        79va)
Lam78.Editions:
Pickering,   Oliver S. 
             “A Third Text of ‘Say me viit in þe brom.’” 
             English Studies
         63 (1982): 20-2: 21-2.
